summary: This is a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, to Judge J. Nathan, detailing ongoing interference with attorney-client communication at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). The letter alleges breaches of confidentiality in video teleconferences, unauthorized third-party access, and restrictive conditions that hamper Maxwell's trial preparation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), currently detained at MDC. Her defense counsel alleges interference with her attorney-client communication and restrictive conditions impacting her trial preparation.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, author of the letter to Judge Nathan, detailing complaints about MDC's interference with confidential attorney-client communications and restrictive detention conditions.

persons.name: J. Nathan
persons.context: The presiding judge in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the letter is addressed, requesting judicial intervention regarding MDC's conduct.

persons.name: Leon
persons.context: An MDC technician tasked with dealing with Ms. Maxwell's electronics issues. He was reportedly present during a breach of the Zoom room used for attorney-client VTCs.

connections.description: Sternheim is the defense attorney representing Maxwell, as evidenced by the detailed letter advocating for her client's rights and trial preparation capabilities.
Leon is an MDC technician tasked with handling Maxwell's electronics issues, indicating a service and security relationship within the detention facility.

events.title: VTC Monitor Placement Issue
events.description: The MDC placed the VTC monitor inside a box with a screen, severely impacting Maxwell's ability to see counsel and documents. This issue was later resolved.

events.title: MDC Mandates Platform Change
events.description: MDC Legal informed defense counsel that VTCs must switch from the defense's WebEx platform to a Zoom platform provided by the MDC, citing complaints from Maxwell.

events.title: Zoom Room Breach
events.description: Third parties accessed the Zoom room used by Maxwell and her counsel for a VTC. This breach was reported to and witnessed by MDC staff, including technician Leon.

events.title: Restricted In-Person Visit
events.description: During an in-person legal visit, Maxwell and Sternheim were told they could not pass documents, frustrating the productivity of the four-hour meeting.

events.title: Allegation of VTC Recording
events.description: Defense counsel expressed concern to MDC Legal that VTCs between Maxwell and counsel may have been tape recorded by the MDC, a concern that aligns with prior suspicions of interference.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) - implied as Maxwell's place of detention
keyFacts: Defense counsel alleges the MDC changed the VTC platform from defense-controlled WebEx to MDC-provided Zoom due to complaints from Maxwell about a participant named 'NER/BRO' appearing on screen and adjusting settings.
A breach occurred on August 12, 2021, when third parties accessed the Zoom room used for Maxwell's attorney-client VTCs, which was reported to MDC staff.
Maxwell's ability to prepare for trial is severely hampered by restrictions on document sharing during VTCs and in-person visits, and limits on the quantity of legal materials she can use.

Defense counsel has raised the serious concern that VTCs between Maxwell and her lawyers may have been recorded by the MDC, constituting a potential violation of attorney-client privilege and constitutional rights.

The letter requests the court to order MDC Legal to show cause for the platform change, the delay in resuming VTCs, and to provide a sworn statement on whether VTCs have been interfered with or recorded.
